title: Assign one point zero to num

content.description: In the code segment below, assume that the int variables a and b have been properly declared and initialized.
content.question: int c = a;int d = b;c += 3;d--;double num = c;num /= d;Which of the following best describes the behavior of the code segment?

choices.label: The code segment stores the value of (a + 3) / b in the variable num.
The code segment stores the value of (a + 3) / (b - 1) in the variable num.
The code segment stores the value of (a + 3) / (b - 2) in the variable num.
The code segment causes a runtime error in the last line of code because num is type double and d is type int.

content.answer: The code segment stores the value of (a + 3) / (b - 1) in the variable num.

skill.text: 4.A: Describe the behavior of a code segment or program.
